description: Erection of ground and first floor rear extension with 1x rooflight to create 2x self contained residential units (1x 1bed, 1x 2bed) with associated recycling facilities, cycle and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The facing materials to be used in the construction of the proposed development hereby permitted shall be those specified on the application form and approved drawings or such other materials as have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and shall thereafter be retained as such. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Cycle storage facilities for 2no. cycles shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, such facilities to be permanently retained at the site. Reason: To ensure the provision of cycle storage facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Refuse storage facilities and recycling facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted in accordance with details which shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development, such facilities to be permanently retained at the site. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development shall either be stored within this dedicated store/area as shown on the approved plans, or internally within the building(s) that form part of the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material shall be stored or placed for collection on the public highway or pavement, except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Evidence must be submitted to the Council confirming that the development hereby permitted has achieved no less than the C02 reductions (ENE1), internal water usage (WAT1) standards equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4.  Evidence requirements are detailed in the "Schedule of Evidence Required for Post Construction Stage from ENE1 and WAT1 of the Code for Sustainable Homes Guide.  Evidence to demonstrate a 19% reduction compared to 2013 Part L regulations and internal water usage rates of 105L/day.Reason: In the interests of Sustainability and Energy Conservation in accordance with Policies 5.2 (Minimising Carbon Dioxide Emissions) and 5.3 (Sustainable Design & Construction) of the London Plan (July 2011) and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no windows or other openings (other than those hereby approved) shall be formed in the south east or north west elevation walls of the extension without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The roof of the extension hereby permitted shall not be converted or used as a balcony or a sitting out area, and no access shall be gained except for maintenance purposes.Reason: To protect the amenities and privacy of the adjoining residential properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The site and building works required to implement the development shall be only carried out between the hours of 08.00 and 18.00 Mondays to Fridays and between 08.00 and 13.00 on Saturdays and not at all on Bank Holidays and Sundays.Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining residential occupiers in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant is advised to contact the Highways NRSWA Team at the earliest opportunity to acquire a permit for services connections, and also to obtain all necessary highways licenses, including for scaffolding and hoardings. Construction traffic must observe all highway width/weight restrictions. Prior to commencing construction activity the applicant is advised to contact our Street Inspections Team to arrange for a pre-condition highway survey to be arranged since they (the applicant) will be held liable for the cost of any remediation works to the public highway that arise from the construction activity.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Conditions 3 (external facing materials), 4 (boundary fences/gates/walls) & 5 (Construction Management Plan) of planning permission 19/00208/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Conditions 3 (External Facing Material), 10.A (Sustainable Drainage), 14 (Waste and recycling) and 18 (Levels) of planning permission 20/01089/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Condition 7 (Refuse storage facilities), 10 (Landscaping details), 13 (M4(3) unit details) and 14 (14-M4(2) unit details) of planning permission 17/12932/FUL have been assessed and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Conditions 5 (Construction Method Statement) and 12 (Sustainable Drainage) of planning permission 20/01103/FUL have been assessed by relevant consultants and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details for Conditions 3 (External  facing materials), 4 (Levels), 5 (Hard and soft landscape works), 6 (Flood risk), 7 (Sustainable drainage), 8 (Construction Method Statement), and 14 (Boundary fences or walls) of planning permission 17/14271/FUL Appeal Ref: APP/Z5630/W/17/3181894 have been assessed by relevant officers and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details.

The site comprises a terraced dwelling.7 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and 1 objection has been received relating to loss of light/sunlight. The concerns raised will be taken into consideration during the assessment of the application and detailed below.The key areas of assessment are: - The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings. DesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: While the proposed single storey rear extension would not strictly adhere to the recommendations set out in the Residential Design SPD, in terms of depth (4m v. 3-3.5m), however it would have an appropriate height and given that similar extensions are viewed in the immediate vicinity, officers consider it would appear an appropriate addition to the host property, and that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. While the proposed rear dormer roof extension would not be appropriately set in from the side roof slopes, given that it would be set down from the ridge and up from the eaves, it would appear a proportionate addition to the original dwelling. Further, officers note that  proposed rear dormer roof extension would appear modern in appearance, given the use of zinc cladding, and while it would differ in appearance from the original roofslope, given that it would not be viewed from the streetscene, officers consider it would appear an appropriate addition to the host property, and would not detract from the character and appearance of the surrounding area.AmenityPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance. Officer Comment: Officers note that both adjoining properties benefit from existing rear extensions, and as such it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy. In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The site comprises a detached dwelling located on the south western side of Akerman Road and on the corner of Seething Wells Lane.247 neighbouring properties have been notified of the proposals and 1 neutral representation has been received relating to the inability to view all plans online and inappropriate design/layout. Officers have made public all the plans and reconsulted as necessary. The remaining concerns raised will be taken into consideration during the assessment of the application and detailed below.RBK Tree Officer - No objection.The key areas of assessment are: - The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings. DesignWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: Whilst the proposed extensions would not strictly comply with the parameters of the Residential Design SPD 2013 in terms of set down from the main roof ridge (in terms of the two storey side extension) and height (in terms of the single storey rear extension) the proposed development would be subordinate and proportionate. Overall, the proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. While there are no protected trees on site, the proposal would involve the removal of some trees within the site. Officers consider that this would be acceptable given the current health of these trees, and that they would be replaced with higher quality trees.AmenityPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance. Officer Comment: Given the modest scale of the proposed extensions and siting in relation to neighbouring properties, and that no windows are proposed to the side elevations, it is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy. In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan (2021), Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

The fee required for your pre- planning application is Â£ 250.00.  Payment can be made via either our Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002, by cheque made payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or online via the Kingston council website.
Please confirm the description ''Erection of first floor extension in existing bungalow.''

Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.The proposal includes drop kerb and vehicular cross over, please revise the location plan to show the red outline in the proposed site including the front pavement, where drop kerb will be proposed.

Please provide a copy of proposed block plan scaled 1:500, providing a scale bar showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.  The block plan should also show adjoining properties to the side and rear and those opposite in full outline.The submitted proposed block plan does not show the proposed development.

The description in the submitted application form also includes ''Replacement of existing iron gate with wooden gate'', whereas the proposed front profile shows iron railings to match existing gate, please clarify the description.We have not received any amended application form.

Please provide all corresponding plans/elevations approved under the previous planning permission (the previously approved versions should be clearly marked as 'Approved', or be otherwise clearly identifiable.)
Please submit the proposed plans and elevations, which are relevant to this applications. The submitted floor plans, elevations and other documents are not labelled as proposed.
